Name: treatment of heat carrier liquid, 40% C3H8O2, wastewater treatment | heat carrier liquid, 40% C3H8O2 | EN15804GD, U
Category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/37:Sewerage/370:Sewerage/3700:Sewerage
Description: This is an inventory for the disposal of a selected wastewater in Global. The reference unit is 1 m3 wastewater input. This activity represents the treatment of a specific wastewater in a WWT plant (while direct emissions and sewering are heeded in the upstream market dataset for this wastewater). The size of the treatment plant infrastructure is for a supranational region average territory situation. The assumed size of the WWTP treats 82.2 Mio m3 per year. The mixture of WWTP with one, two, or three stages is 8.2%-41.2%-50.6%. The actual, waste-specific oxygen requirement in the biological stages is 79.836825 kg O. The digestion process produces 18210.309 litres of biogas with an energy content of 421.7635MJ. 60.5% of the biogas is utilized for energy. The remainder is flared. The gross electric efficiency is 26.564%. The gross thermal efficiency is 47.853%. After digestion, the remaining total sludge mass (dry matter) is 133.4kg DM.
